hackathon-description-text: Hack the Anvil will be a brand new hacking experience at Purdue University. On March 6-8 get ready for a 400-person, Purdue-only, 36-hour hackathon hosted at The Anvil.

hackathon-judges.judge-name: Sponsors will judge their own prizes

hackathon-eligibility: Only Purdue students in teams of 4 or fewer may submit hacks for judging.
hackathon-requirements:
Submissions must contain the following:
- Screenshots and/or a video of your project and a link to view it online, if applicable
- An accurate description
- All team members must be added on the submission form
- Table number so judges know where to find you
hackathon-rules:
- All hacks must be submitted to ChallengePost by 11:00am on Sunday, March 8
- You may not build off of exisiting projects or write project specific code prior to the event. Use of 3rd party APIs and libraries is allowed.
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards.
- Please comply with all instructions from Hack The Anvil organizers.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: iPad Mini for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Apple - Best iOS or OS X app

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Apple TV for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Apple - Best iOS or OS X app runners up

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: iPad Mini for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Cisco - Best Internet of Things Hack
Interactive Intelligence - Most Innovative Integration of InIn API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each team member can choose their own prize
Pro developer account for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Wolfram - Best Use of Wolfram Alpha
